Reviews.Title: “hard to beat hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mrs Sally W Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: there may be hotels in more imposing buildings, with more beautiful furnishings, but frankly you would be wasting your money staying at them. The Bridge Hotel is an excellent location, really quiet at night, the rooms were basic, but very clean and comfortable, the service was second to none, nothing was too much trouble, the breakfast was plentiful, fresh and well laid out. it is very close to the metro, the only form of public transport we used, as everything was an easy walk from the hotel, we hired bikes from them one day, very competitively priced. We both loved it and would not hesitate in using it again or recommending it!

Reviews.Title: “The bridge Hotel”
Reviews.Author: belanda1
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from Amsterdam where I was staying at the Hotel Brigde. I'm very satisfied with everything I got by choosing this hotel. Accommodation was satisfying - clean and tidy rooms, great breakfast, the location from which all the main attractions of the city were accessible to us, and most of all I'd like to praise the staff who was extremely friendly and available whenever we needed something. My husband and I and a few friends who were with us have only compliments for this hotel. I'd definitely recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Functional 3* accommodation on Amstel river”
Reviews.Author: Gaurangd12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the bridge for 2 nights and it was a functional 3* hotel. We were looking for a decent place in central Amsterdam and the bridge did just that.

Reviews.Title: “Staying”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It was a plaisure to stay in the hotel. A little sing about the room. There is no decoration. Yvon BUZZELLI

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: beerstl
Reviews.Content: This quiet hotel is located off the Amstel River. It is close to the flower market and several museums and just a short walk to the Waterlooplein tram stop. The staff was friendly and courteous and the rooms were clean. Breakfast was served daily.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, good service, acceptable room”
Reviews.Author: Riverqtee
Reviews.Content: This place is centrally located for Amsterdam on foot. Our first night we easily walked to the red light district and beyond. The hotel staff is friendly and helpful. The free breakfast isn't superb, but it's free where most hotels charge 17 euro's or more per person. The "bar" is a counter attached to reception where the desk staff will pour you a drink. However, at 2.5 euro per beer, its the cheapest beer in town. The downside for us was the room amenities. There are only 2 actual gym lockers instead of a closet, and there are no dresser drawers. There are no counters in the bathroom either (and most women NEED counter space). We pretty much lived out of our suitcases which I'm not a big fan of doing. The tv is small, and there's no in room coffee machine. Stay here for the location, the service and the breakfast. Stay somewhere else if you are planning on a longer trip and need to settle down in a room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodation”
Reviews.Author: kazza123Liverpool Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very welcoming hotel, good location with excellent views over the Amstel canal. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anybody travelling to Amsterdam including families. We stayed in the Amstel Gold Apartment which had two bathrooms, two bedrooms and large living area with great views. Breakfast was nice and there was plenty to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, so clean, great location”
Reviews.Author: Margaret Anne V Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: 15 of us stayed here we all thought it was just perfect. Great location friendly staff and rooms were very comfy. Breakfast was lovely constantly being topped up. I can not fault this place all 15 people in our party enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for a night at the CarrÃ© (theater) and for sightseeings”
Reviews.Author: jmk50_3
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel because we had tickets for an evening performance in the theater with is just next door. The room we got (203) had a nice view over the river the Amstel and we could see the most beautiful bridge of Amsterdam (de magere brug) very clearly. The Jewish "triangle" (historic museum, Portuguese synagogue and the Hollandsche Schouwburg memorial) are within walking distance. Hortus Botanicus and the Dutch resistance museum too.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: N C Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 days at this hotel. It was very clean, helpful staff, great location, large variety at breakfast! Would recommend to all!

Reviews.Title: “Does not live up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: Isabelle K
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel based on excellent reviews in Tripadvisor but, sadly, it didn't quite live up to expectations. Good points first: the location is great; quiet but well connected, with restaurants and museums within short walking distance and a pretty canal just outside . The hotel and its rooms are clean and functional; the bed was reasonably comfortable. However, the common areas and dining room have a distinct hostel feel to them. The WiFi isn't great. The breakfast buffet contained a poor selection of cheap products, all of which tasted like something out of an "economy" packet. The luggage storage room wasn't locked and didn't feel secure. If the Bridge Hotel had been 30-40 per cent less expensive, it would have deserved a 4- or even 5-star rating. However, for EUR130 a night in low season, it simply isn't good enough.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view”
Reviews.Author: Tontotravels
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam in February can be a cold and uninviting place however the welcome by reception was friendly and helpful. I stayed here last year in ground floor room in the center of the building. This year I had a room overlooking the canal which was very pleasent albeit not the most scenic of views. This hotel is clean and comfortable with good ensuite facilites although the lino floor lets the comfort level slip a little. Nice fresh linen and confortable beds makes it a recommend altough the price for the room was on the high side at â‚¬135. My advice is shop around for the best deal. Breakfast was good although I hate those toast machines which arent set right and give you a slice of limp pale straw coloured cooked bread. No hot food was in evidence on the buffet but a good selection of meats and cheeses etc were on show.

Reviews.Title: “Great Apartment in Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FlossSydney
Reviews.Content: Our family of 2 adults and 3 teenagers stayed in the Bridge Hotel for 4 nights over new year. We had the Amstel Gold apartment, a roomy, homely, lovely 'home' for our 4 nights in Amsterdam. We were close to all metro and tram routes to anywhere we needed to go. on foot it was 15 mins walk to the main shopping area and no more than 30 mins walk to anywhere. There were many nice restaurants nearby. The living room was spacious, with comfortable furniture including a good sized table for meals and spreading out. The apartment had a separate bedroom and another separate sleeping area, away from the living room, two bathrooms and a completely workable kitchen. The view over the canal was amazing and on New years Eve was a real treat with fireworks galore all over the city skyline. Very comfortable. Buffet breakfast in the dining room was a great start to the day. The hotel has many rooms but only 2 apartments, both similar I believe. Be advised that there are no lifts so all the luggage had to go up to the 4th floor, but worth it. Reception staff were very efficient and pleasant and we were able to leave our luggage with them once we had checked out. Can't recommend the apartment highly enough for a place to feel at home, it is not luxurious and the TV's could be updated but after a day beating the pavements in Amsterdam it was great to flop on to the lounge and make yourself a snack and grab a drink from the fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Start of a Family Holiday in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: hann9
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to get a studio (on top floor) which was hugely spacious and slept 4 easily with lots of room. (Yes it is a hike up lots of stairs and a bit painful with luggage but absolutely worth it for the space and views we had) We are a family of 9 and the other rooms were a double also on a high level, along with a triple on one of the lower floors. All were actually very nice, with the studio room allowing us all to meet at different times of the day without feeling squashed. The hotel is within walking distance to Rembrandt Square and we did walk here from the train station with our luggage, but the trams are very handy for those who don't want to walk. We tended to walk everywhere and only caught a tram back to the train station from the hotel at the end of our stay. Reception staff were lovely and one recommended a very cool Ethiopian restaurant only 5 mins walk away which was a unique experience.

Reviews.Title: “Well situated, friendly great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ianhw_12
Reviews.Content: Stayed here several times in the past 12 months. Check-in is fast, friendly and efficient - rooms scrupulously clean and well fitted. The 'All you Can Eat' breakfast included in the room price is an excellent way to start the day. Ideally suited of access to trams and metro ( Central Station ) only 2 stops on the Metro - 10 minutes at most.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - will come back!”
Reviews.Author: OsloMarianne
Reviews.Content: After almost one year of planning, we were all very excited about our "girls trip" to Amsterdam, and we wew not disappointed at all! Amsterdam is the perfect place for joy, and the bridge hotel is just lovely! Friendly and extremely helpful staff, and very light and moderne rooms; my room even had a balcony and the most lovely view over the canals - ask for this when you order, it might cost you a little extra, but not very much. The hotel was also very central, but at the same time in a calm area so that it is possible to sleep at nights. The only minus was that we missed egg & bacon for breakfast and that the bread was a little dry two of the days - they did not refill the nice rolls when finished. However; very nice, we will all come back!

Reviews.Title: “Location & Service yea, but interiors nay”
Reviews.Author: mrcox79
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay here because we wanted a small hotel looking out over water and The Bridge doesn't disappoint with lovely views over the Amstel and the Magere Bridge. The service is helpful and friendly, as you'd expect from the Dutch character, and there's plenty of good eating along Utrectstrasse(?), 10 minutes from the front door. The only slight disappointment about the stay was that the room interiors are rather "High School Funky" with linoleum floors, gunmetal grey gym lockers, and worn out mattress springs. Depending on how much this matters to you, it may affect your choice of venue...

Reviews.Title: “Good 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: madones
Reviews.Content: This is quite a good hotel. We stayed here over the new year period. We walked into the centre but its a good 15 minute walk. Breakfast was ok - a bit basic for me but was adequate enough. The booking we had said a skylight but we got a window, which was great! Staff were fine. think I would stay in this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Ceroontrip
Reviews.Content: A nice & boutique hotel with good location. Staff very helpful, breakfast excellent. Only drawback is limited internet connection.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Robin S
Reviews.Content: Three nights in the Bridge Hotel in Room 13 (triple room - double and single) ideal for our family, with a great view of the canal. Extreemly clean with cleaning and bed making done every day. Excellent breakfast buffet, as much as you like with a fantastic range of food. Staff could not be too helpful with suggestions. 5 mins walk to nearest tram stop and 10 mins to town (walking) but we purchased a E7 24 hour tram pass fantastic value for money and never walked anywhere ! Dont agree with too far out, I walked to Rembrant Square just to get a couple of buns !! Had drinks from the bar (was suprised how low we were charged when added to the room !) Will be back and booking here again

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem- in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: gailchick
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights in the charming Bridge Hotel in November. Yes it is a tram ride away from the center - but for me this is what makes the hotel so nice. Being right on the canal and Amstel River allows one to experience the true nature of Amsterdam. It is close to the former Jewish Quarter - museum and Spanish Portuguese Synagogue and Hermitage Museum as well as a short walk to a wonderful street-Utretchestraat - with its shops and delicious choice of restaurants - including Tempo Doeloe reputed to be the finest Indonesian restaurant in the city (reservations necessary) The hotel staff is very helpful especially Nanci and accomodating and the rooms are ample,. breakfast bountiful. tips: van Gogh museum has Friday night hours/ check out wonderful Amsterdam Historical Museum/ try to get to Anne Frank House during the week expect lines as venue is small - take tram/bus early am to fascinating flower auction in Aalsmeer

Reviews.Title: “A nice choice (with some exceptions)”
Reviews.Author: Bekim A
Reviews.Content: A breathtaking view, and a pretty nice location (10 mins to Dam Square with Tram) you will enjoy this hotel! Actually it was a bit far away from the center, and we spent too much money on transportation because of the fact that we couldn't just walk to the center. And also make sure that you don't have Claustrophobia, since many rooms have no windows. I recommend you to stay in a room with a window because you'll need some fresh air! Except for those, everything was good, clean rooms, friendly staff and a selective breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: southernlass1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bridge Hotel Sunday last weekend, and we enjoyed the friendly staff in particular Marlene and Nancy, both were so helpful. Breakfast was excellent, great choice of cold meats, bread, cereals well done. The room was great, comfortable bed, lovely view. I am so glad we found this hotel, near good restaurants, in particular L'Express on Utrechtsestraat 29, we had a fantastic 3 course meal for 25 euros. I would certainly recommend the Bridge hotel to anyone wishing to stay in Amsterdam. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: FunTraveler25
Reviews.Content: What a neat little hotel. Great location on the Amstel River and close to public transit. We requested a room on a lower floor since the hotel has no lift. We were happy to find upon check-in that our canal view room was on the first level. Even with this close proximity to the reception desk our room was very quiet. Breakfast was good and the selection was complete. Our hosts were very friendly and very helpful in their local travel suggestions.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: Rasmanrulz
Reviews.Content: We were impressed by this hotel. The staff were incredibly helpful and our room was great. My only criticism was it was a bit tricky to find, though I think this was probably my fault as i'd marked the wrong place on our map! I'd much rather stay in this hotel in this location than somewhere like Dam Square

Reviews.Title: “Clean, cozy hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Kala_Mata_2010
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed this hotel. The location is fantastic! It's only a 10 minute walk to the city centre with all the bars, coffeeshops, etc, but the hotel itself is in a very quiet area (Amstel), with lots of great restaurant options nearby. [Hint: if you like Thai food, you MUST try "Na Siam" which is only a few streets away. The food was absolutely amazing!! Look it up on Tripadvisor!] The room was very clean and comfortable, and the bathroom was also very clean with a large shower. We had a room on the ground level facing the inner courtyard. While we quite enjoyed this room, the noise from people going up and down the staircases, and the hotel staff going into the supply rooms that were nearby got somewhat. I would recommend that you ask for a room on one of the higher floors. We did not pay for the breakfast, so cannot comment on that. However, there are plenty of little shops nearby where you can buy yourself some baked goods in the morning if you choose not to pay for the hotel breakfast. The hotel staff we dealt with were all very pleasant and helpful. Overall, great hotel! We loved the peaceful location, but also how close we were to the city centre. Will definitely stay here again next time!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and spacious room”
Reviews.Author: kiriath
Reviews.Content: My husband and i had a room facing the canal. room was spacious and bed was comfy. Toilet was spacious too. View was spectacular. Everything was just fine. Breakfast was provided in a buffet style, it was good enough but not great. Location wise, it took us approx 15 mins to walk the nearest station. All in all, good value for money if u are comtemplating for a hotel stay in amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “just great!”
Reviews.Author: Jurandy
Reviews.Content: great staff, great location, great service! It could have a better breakfast...

Reviews.Title: “Must be the best hotel of its size in the city”
Reviews.Author: BaldEagleHarrogate
Reviews.Content: A very pleasant owner managed/run hotel. During my recent stay the owner realised that most of the guests were attending a conference at the RAI Centre and personally turned up early every morning to get us early breakfasts as we had 08.00 starts. Now that is how to run a service industry! Standards are good. Breakfast is good. Staff are all helpful, efficient and friendly. Enjoys one of the best locations in the city. On the riverfront with a canal down one side and the rear. 50 metres away from the Carre Theatre. A good range of bars and restaurants only 200/300 metres away.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: BostonRoadWarrior
Reviews.Content: Just checked out of the Bridge and couldn't have been more pleased with my stay. The room was spotless, the hotel was quiet but convenient, and the staff were overwhelmingly friendly. I have pretty high standards - up to 200 nights per year in a hotel and generally stay in higher end places - but this was a personal trip so I was looking for value. The room wasn't "luxurious" as defined by 5 star standards but there was nothing missing and I wanted for nothing. More importantly the room was bright and clean. You'll see other hotel reviews where people complain about the outside noise. My room (#204) was so quiet that I actually slept with the window open to enjoy the night air. The hotel is perfectly situated - a short walk to many tourist destinations. I did not take advantage of the breakfast but would assume it's as good as everything else. Nex time I'm in Amsterdam I will definitely be back at the Bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: aclampkin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in May 2011. Great little find. The location was in a very good part of town. It was a few blocks away from the metro. We were able to walk many of the cities main attractions. Lots of nice restaurants nearby. Keep in mind this hotel has no lift so if scaling stairs is a problem, this hotel will not work for you. The rate included breakfast which consist of hard-boiled eggs, ham, cheese, toast, muffins, fruit, yogurt, cereal, plenty to get your day started. The room is small, but very clean. I travel all over the world on a moderate budget and a clean room is top priority for me. This is a boutique hotel, which is what I prefer to stay in while in Europe, so don't expect 5 star amenities. Expect the charm, the courteous staff and the neighborhood feeling you get at this boutique hotel. For those of you traveling from the States, look for reviews that focus on the cleanliness of the rooms rather than the star rating as their rating system is not quite the same. I would definitely recommend this hotel and will stay here again on my next visit. L

Reviews.Title: “Terrible planning!”
Reviews.Author: mish02
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean & good location etc etc but my stay here was ruined by 2 things. 1. When I booked I got told â‚¬248 and had my email confirmation to prove that but when I went to pay it was â‚¬260. I know it's not much but the principle is that's how much I was told the rooms were and not sure who stuffed it up but good customer service would suggest you foot the â‚¬12 difference. 2. Who puts rooms in receptions? Everytime anyone checked in you could hear it. If I wanted rooms like this I would be in a hostel! We specifically asked to have a room with a balcony on a higher floor. Instead we got none of our requests and the worse possible room in the hotel. Absolutely ridiculous!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic View”
Reviews.Author: Keith17Uk
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at The Bridge several years ago we returned with out 3 teenage kids. All booked direct on line, the helpful staff suggested The Amstel Light apartment. Amsterdam is not cheap and you are looking at at around 295 euros per night B&B here - but the aprtment was fantastic - great views over the beautiful Amstel a great spacious and modern well equiped apartment (3 TVs and 2 loos) with breakfast thrown in. Great location - even our teens managed to walk some of the time and appeared to enjoy Amsterdam - the free wifi in the hotel probably helped. With a nice friendly bar a few steps away from the hotel mum and dad could even pop for a quick drink in the evening. I will go again without a doubt

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel for a family visiting amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: amir_israel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for two nights. We took the apartment. The place was amazing - great apartment, very cozy, felt like a home away from home. Traveling with two little girls it's important to find a place you can come back to and feel at home - this was the place. Also, as adults it was great staying in a place that is hospitable and feel like is not trying to cut any corners or save money by being cheap. The only problem is that the apartment is on the fourth floor and there is no elevator so you need to carry your luggage up for floors yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located between Waterlooplein and Weesperplain, the hotel is in a good position for getting to see all the”
Reviews.Author: PeterLeicestershire
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located between Waterlooplein and Weesperplain, the hotel is in a good position for getting to see all the central sights of Amsterdam. This is a traditional hotel with friendly and helpful staff. Note that the walk from the nearest public transport can include crossing up to 3 canal bridges which can be a little tricky with trolley luggage, especially with cyclists coming at you from all directions with no signals given! Amsterdam is relatively expensive with hotels costing at least 50% more than similar hotels in Brussels say. The room rate of 134 Euros for a room for 2 including breakfast (August 2011) is reasonable for Amsterdam. The only "extras" included is free Wifi and an older traditional TV (not flat screen). The shower was a little feeble and there was no fridge, room safe or free tea/coffee making facilities. However a hairdryer could be borrowed free of charge from the reception where a hotel safe is available if required. For the 1st time visitor to Amsterdam, the "I amsterdam City Card" is a must (available at the tourist information office opposite the entrance to the Central Station). This tourist card is actually 2 separate cards, one for the public transport and the other for entrance to sights. Whilst 59 Euros for 72 hours sounds expensive, it includes all public transport, a 1-hour canal trip and entrance to a number of museums which could cost between 8-14 euros each. Note that the public transport card must be registered both on entry AND exit from trams, etc. Failure to register on exit will void the card! Two restaurants of note are the "Tujuh Laret" (Utrechtsestraat 73), for Dutch Indonesian cuisine, and the "Haesje Claes" (Spuistraat 273-275), for traditional Dutch (and other) cuisine. Both offer good value and very good food with friendly staff. The "Tujuh Laret" is rather basic, somewhat "rustic" inside, but the food is worth it. However, on our visit we found the restaurant relatively hot and humid and so less comfortable than we liked. The "Haesje Claes" is a traditional restaurant which is comfortable but very busy. If you haven't booked, then get there before 6.30pm to be reasonably sure of getting a table! We liked the food and service at the "Haesje Claes" so much that we ate there 3 nights running! In central Amsterdam, watch out for cyclists (both pedal and motorised) coming from all directions including along and across pavements, with no signals and the expectation that you'll get out of their way! Despite this, there's plenty to see and do. Our recommended sights include: Amsterdam Museum, Van Gogh Museum (get there early to avoid long queues), Rembrandt's house, Anne Frank's House/Museum (again, get there early to avoid long queues), Koninklijk Paleis, the Hidden Church (inside a house), Rijksmuseum, de Oude Kerk, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Cabbagetowntoronto
Reviews.Content: Location is charming,just near the Amstel river on a quiet lane. I really enjoyed the buffet breakfast, and the lovely decorated breakfast room. The included breakfast is definitely a big plus, and the food quality/choice is enjoyable. Staff was helpful and friendly. On the negative side, I found out the furniture of my room to be really dated and the bathroom really dark. Room was clean and comfortable enough, with a charming little balcony facing the river, but it could be so much better with newer furniture! Strongly recommend to rent a bike at the hotel. The bikes are locked just in front of the hotel so very easy to step in for a ride, rental price is reasonable. It is charged on your room, so you will avoid to waste time going to nearby rental stores, and also avoid the whole deposit/ID hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice location, simple w/all facilities+ nice buffet breakfast included!”
Reviews.Author: gabyolecin
Reviews.Content: I will come back x sure! They know how to treat guests with simple sings. I had asked for a tea at night and i didn t have to pay for it. Tons of candies at front desk. I booked a standard room which was ok: free wifi, confortable beds, small but modern and clean bathroom!

Reviews.Title: “On the River”
Reviews.Author: JulieAnnArm
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in the triple room and one night had an extra bed added and there was still space for us. Our room was on the lower level and our window looked right out onto the river - beautiful. The hotel was in a great location for us - slightly away from the bustle but only a ten minute walk to numerous restaurants. Breakfast was a big buffet with lots of selection. Receptionists were very helpful. We got a taxi to the hotel from the train station, but you could walk/subway.

Reviews.Title: “Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: TravelerAl46
Reviews.Content: Best breakfast included in price I've ever seen. Desk Clerks were very helpful and knew their stuff. Just a short walk to a tram stop which gives you access to all of teh city. Rooms plain but clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good value”
Reviews.Author: tpabob
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Bridge Hotel spanning Queen's Day in Amsterdam. The location was good (far enough away from the hustle and bustle but close enough to walk to the fun areas and close by the subway station to the Central Station. The hotel was nicely appointed but, as a senior with arthritis problems, having to haul suitcases up and down stairs was difficult. If your healthy, this is a great place and the morning breakfast can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, helpful staff, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: LisanCharlie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in June. There was a small problem with our room on arrival (not the hotel's fault; a guest had given the wrong information) which was fixed quickly. The staff was very helpful with making reservations and giving advice. They do have bikes to rent, but only 6 for the whole place. There are plenty of places to rent nearby. The room was large, the bed was the most comfortable we had in six weeks in Europe. Free wifi. The bathroom was poorly lit and smelled like the sewer, which was really the worst part. It's located right on the canal near a bridge; it's beautiful at night. It's not too far from the train station (and downtown), but there's a metro stop three blocks away if you'd rather take that. We really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value.”
Reviews.Author: jbrown2618
Reviews.Content: Freindly. helpful staff. Quiet . Ample breakfasts. Very clean. Rooms good-sized for a city known for its small rooms. Very good value for its location and price. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, Comfy Family Inn Direct on Amstel!”
Reviews.Author: fehler
Reviews.Content: Small inn with big heart. Family owned with personal touches & adorable dogs in lobby by fireplace. Cozy. Afternoon tea and beverages available at front desk. Community room with books, maps and computer for guest use. Large, traditional Dutch buffet breakfast served. Rooms vary greatly in size, view and prices. Some with canal or river view. Singles available. Fresh modern room decor in a historic blg. Convenient location by Hermitage Museum and tram stops. Mostly Euro tourists, a plus for me!

Reviews.Title: “Totally exceeded our expectations - great value!”
Reviews.Author: LeLotusBleu08
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was friendly, attentive, and helpful. The room was spacious, clean, quiet and comfortable. Especially loved the French doors that opened onto the little balcony overlooking one of the canals. Free wi-fi in the room was more than adequate. The breakfast was one of the best we have had; well tended by the staff and there was plenty to choose from.Terrific location- walking distance (30 minutes to Central Station) to most of the city center or the tram stop was a 5 minute walk. We loved this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Well situated, outdated style on rooms”
Reviews.Author: Marit35
Reviews.Content: We ordred the room with canalview long time ago, and the view was splendid, until a big construction company closed of the street and started to build a stage for the Queen that would visit 5 days later. This was something that disturbed our sleep Saturday and Sunday morning, when the workers (that apparently lived in our hotel) started to shout and turn on the engines. The hotel could easily have informed us about this in advanced, but they did not. Easy to rent bike, and nice breakfast, but the rooms must have been "decorated" in the 80Â´s.

Reviews.Title: “Good Apartment for a Family Stay”
Reviews.Author: keep0nm0ving
Reviews.Content: The Bridge hotel worked great for my family of 4.....book an apartment. The location is good, not great.....it was appropriatly priced for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in an ideal area!”
Reviews.Author: MadMountie
Reviews.Content: Having just arrived home from Amsterdam this morning, I wanted to write this review straight away. The Bridge Hotel is a quirky and cute hotel close to the centre of Amsterdam and all the night life but far enough away for a peaceful night's sleep and definitely in the prettier part of the city. Even though we had a basement room which was older than others in the hotel, it was clean and comfortable and completely adequate for our needs. Our windows looked right out over the canal and it was a lovely view to wake up to. The triple room had plenty of space for 3 females and all that travel with us and the beds were extremely comfortable. Breakfast was plentiful and set us up for a day's shopping or sightseeing. The staff were extremely helpful and couldn't do enough for us. We even had one of the staff from reception stop us on the street on her day off to ask if we were enjoying ourselves and gave us further recommendations on a good restaurant for our last night. Talk about good customer service! Will definitely go back to this lovely city and will stay at The Bridge again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: miss_akh
Reviews.Content: Staff very helpful and pleasant throughout our stay. Room nice, clean. Had booked "basic double room" but was more than satisfied. Bathroom nice, also clean - the towels we had used replaced daily. Nice selection at breakfast, on until 10 which was handy after a night drinking. A mix of young and old in the hotel, although very quiet which suited us. Walked everywhere from this hotel, into the centre in under 30 mins - however those not so eager could hop on a tram. 10/15 mins from Rembrandt Sq. which has lots of restaurants/bars, but far enough away that don't get the noise. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A brilliant short break in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: JandAengland501
Reviews.Content: An ideal location, away from the trappings of central Amsterdam but an easy amble in to the city centre. Located on a beautiful canal with views on to the Amstel & on an intersection with the Prinsengracht. Perfect for long walks along the quieter canals for a feel of the real Amsterdam. The entire hotel was very clean, simply but not sparsely furnished. There was modern decor throughout without loss of charm. The room was spacious and bright, with a comfortable twin bed which was perfect after a long day exploring Amsterdam. The bathroom had a nice shower & modern fittings including a hairdryer. Very helpful and friendly hotel staff who were delighted to give advice/recommendations/directions. Breakfasts set us up nicely for the whole day! The real advantage of staying in this hotel was simply being set back from the sometimes overwhelming pace of Amsterdam, without having to use transport to get into the centre. We really enjoyed our stay and would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel.Would highly recommend it. Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Trudy1601
Reviews.Content: Really liked this hotel. Went with a group of friends for a weekend away. Graet value for money and really good location. Staff were friendly and helpful. Rooms were clean and modern. It is in a quiet area but not far from the centre by tram (5 mins). Breakfast was really good -buffet style and all you could eat.

Reviews.Title: “A good base to explore the city”
Reviews.Author: Butters_Stotch1986
Reviews.Content: We booked as a base for exploring Amsterdam, and it served its purpose extremely well. We were originally allocated a room on the ground floor opposite reception, but we were immediately moved when we expressed concern about the noise. The room we ended up in was fairly modern, clean and warm, and my only complaints would be that the shower was quite weak and no tea and coffee facilities were available. Breakfast was more than adequate. Walking from the city centre, the hotel was initially quite difficult to find. However, it was easy to locate from both the local metro and tram stops which we used on subsequent occasions, and we also found that when walking it can be easily located by following any of the canals until you reach the Amstel. The hotel's best features were its cycle-hire facility, which was useful as it meant that we could leave from the hotel to go to our chosen destination without having to detour via a separate hire shop, and the location, which was quiet, picturesque, and within walking distance of both the city centre and the museum district. The only negative comment I would make is that the hotel didn't exceed expectations in any way, but it did act as a perfectly good base for exploring Amsterdam's various districts.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but avoid 1st floor/basement floor rooms”
Reviews.Author: traveller68Finland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good base; great location, good breakfast, friendly service. Our group just happened to be unlucky with rooms we got, we got old rooms in the basement or 1st floor and they were quite old and dusty. But as we walked on the corridor and saw into some other rooms they were much nicer with wooden floors etc. So i would advice you to request a room from newer parts of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Base - but no frills”
Reviews.Author: Travelfanatic0
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel other half had a conference out of town and we wished to spend a day or two in Amsterdam afterwards. It was difficult to find but we rang had got clear instructions and scampered our way there quickly. It is next to the Carre Theatre and only a minute away from the 'Skinny Bridge' and the Amsterdam Hermitage which is very convenient. On arrival the reception could not have been more welcoming and gave us a very good map and where to find some good place to eat and also how my other half could make his journey to his conference. We had room 312 right at the top and clearly work has been taking place on the place but the hallways could do with a bit more work. The room was very quiet and was clean, but a bit stark with hard flooring and steel furniture. The bathroom was good and clean but the shower could do with more power and the towels were thin. Be warned no tea/coffee facitities in the room - only down in a lounge near the reception. Breakfast was the standard affair with cold meat,cheeses, seletions of breads, juices and boiled eggs - good value for the price we paid. Next time though we will remember a travel kettle and tea bags!

Reviews.Title: “beutifull quiet hotel in the best location”
Reviews.Author: kremera
Reviews.Content: We just loved staying at The Bridge Hotel, the service was excellent! the breakfast was very good, the room was new furnished and clean. the reception staff were very freindly. the hotel is located in the amstel street, close to all good attractions we walked by foot to any where we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “ideal ideal ideal”
Reviews.Author: glider10
Reviews.Content: Great location, very clean, the staff are very friendly and helpfull. The breakfast room is spotless and the food excellent. A tip for those visiting Amsterdam I suggest you get the OV- Chipcard which gives you unlimited use of the public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Over looking the Amstel River & walking distance to Rembrandt Square and Waterloo Square”
Reviews.Author: liptonst
Reviews.Content: Over looking the Amstel River & walking distance to Rembrandt Square and Waterloo Square. The Bridge Hotel stands out as unique in Amsterdam for me due to the great value and great location. If you are looking for 5 Star Hotel treatment in Amsterdam forget the Bridge Hotel, however if you are looking for clean, safe, close to town budget accommodation then The Bridge Hotel will please you.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: donna_anka
Reviews.Content: usually we stay in 4 stars hotels, but hotels prices in Amsterdam are just unreal so we had to find a more cheap stay. reception - great and very helpful. they helped us with getting around, printing boarding passes (forgot to to it at home), they shown as a laundry nearby where we could wash up our clothes only for 5 EUR, they cooked us coffee whenever we came back.. also they gave us a room with a balcony, because the hotel have not smoking rooms and we are tobacco smokers.. so, it's really great. room - a little bit outdated, but okay. anyway, some rooms were on reconstruction during our stay, so I think, it's not a problem. the only bad thing is sound isolation. it's better to say that rooms have not any sound isolation at all. location - very good. city center is in walking distance, metro is in 10 minutes. there are also a few supermarkets and restaurants nearby. breakfast - has not a big choice but all the things are fresh and tasty. I think it's a really good value for its price.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel close to everything in the city”
Reviews.Author: jwheeler85
Reviews.Content: It takes some time to get to the hotel from the main train station, but once you're there, it's very close to the inner city. It was a short walk to the town squares, shopping areas, and bars. This place had a really comfortable feel to it. The staff was great. Available 24/7, super friendly and more than willing to help us figure out where to go in Amsterdam. Our room was spacious, clean, and quiet. There was a bar and computer in the hotel. A buffet style breakfast was available downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonDave32
Reviews.Content: This hotel is marvellous. We've stayed here a couple of times now and the quality has been consistent. The staff are friendly, nothing was too much trouble for them. The room was a bit basic but then we went for the basement room and got a lower price for it. The breakfast was the usual continental buffet but there was plenty of variety and quantity. Location just away from the city centre on the Amstel river, tranquility when need but just a short walk to the main sites.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: MikeG371
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. I stayed here with a friend over Christmas. The staff were marvellous, really friendly. Location is just outside the main centre but only just, so nice and peaceful but just a short walk to the main sights. Right on the Amstel too. This was in fact the second time I'd stayed there, the first time was about 5 years ago and there has been no drop in quality since then at all. The only thing that stops me top rating it for rooms was that this time it was a bit basic with just a skylight, but then again that was clearly indicated and we expected that.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the climb!”
Reviews.Author: Laarne
Reviews.Content: We loved our top-floor room for four at the Bridge Hotel. We stayed with our two children in late-June 2010. The room sports modern dÃ©cor; two very comfortable double beds; large individual lockers instead of a closet; a separate water closet; sun-drenched modern bathroom with shower; a roof-top terrace with table and chairs, views of two adjacent canals; a kitchen with all amenities; a counter with stools; wonderful windows with views of the canal and a skylight; and, television. Note that itâ€™s approximately 74-step walk up many flights of stairs to get to this fabulous room from the street, including about a dozen steps from the door to the room to the actual room. The breakfast was great: cereals, individually wrapped fancy breads and snacks; several juices; tea/coffee/milk; hard-boiled eggs; rolls and breads; deli meats and cheeses; and, yogurt. Itâ€™s 3-4 block walk from the tram to the hotel. Hotel is an easy walk to Rembrandtplein. Staff was very nice and helpful. I canâ€™t imagine staying anywhere else in Amsterdam. Tourist note: Check-out the super modern biblioteek (library) near the Centraal Station. It has a rooftop deck and inexpensive cafeteria-style restaurant on the top floor that is frequented by young locals. Youâ€™ll be treated to great views of Amsterdam from a different perspective.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky and Cool”
Reviews.Author: CandCL
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in early August durng an excitng weekend when the City was having quite the party. Stayed on the third floor with a view of the side canal even. The rooms were very clean, excellent bathrooms and shower. Good selection at breakfast, especially by European standards. A little off the beaten path, but that's what we were looking for, close enough to major sites, but quiet enough to feel as if you're stayng in a neighborhood. The brown cafe up the street was nice for a drink at the end of the day, and lots of restaurants close by as well. Also, great for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but way too expensive. Great location, though.”
Reviews.Author: Angelika09
Reviews.Content: We stayed in The Bridge Hotel for two nights. It was ok. But for 170â‚¬ per night and judging from the photos I had seen, I had expected something more "boutiquy", made from better materials, instead of youth hostel appeal and cheap plastic floor. Also, the room was cold and the shower did not work properly (low water pressure, warm water only after several minutes). Bad illumination in the bathroom. The breakfast staff was not up to the task of clearing tables and putting out new clean plates.

Reviews.Title: “enormous attic room in ideally located canalside hotel”
Reviews.Author: katyS_9
Reviews.Content: stayed here with three others for a girls' weekend, struggled to find a quad room, but this was fantastic! Spacious airy room with several windows, quirky contemporary decor, and clean roomy shower room with separate toilet. There was even a small balcony to sit outside amongst the rooftops. Modern sofas in centre of room with TV for relaxing. Beds v comfy, quiet location, but only 5mins walk from tram and metro. Breakfast was nothing special but quite adequate, reception staff v helpful and happy to provide fresh milk to take to room. All in all a great find, would definately stay here again. Only downside is the steep and multiple flights of stairs ( no lift) but I think this is pretty universal in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: KiwiinBrighton
Reviews.Content: I spent five nights at the Bridge Hotel. My room was fine although the walls were a bit thin the people staying were relatively quiet. Breakfast was your usual continental but very adequate and the free wireless a bonus. What I loved was the location beside the Carre Theatre and beside the Amstel River and just a short walk to the centre of around 10 minutes. The metro is only a five minute walk and just three stops from Central Station. Really enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “not bad”
Reviews.Author: jcto70
Reviews.Content: I stayed four nights at the Bridge Hotel and I can recommend it. The hotel might not be extremely fancy or even modern in terms of surfaces and interior design, it is nevertheless clean, friendly and definitely worth its rates. My room had a somewhat spartan look but was comfortable and cosy with a view of a small canal. Internet worked fine with a highspeed connection. The bathroom was clean and with a good shower. The best thing was the bed which was very comfortable and I slept very, very good, which is a rare thing in major-city hotels most of the times. Breakfast included many good things and the staff did a good job of keeping up even if there were many breakfast guests at the time. The staff was in general able and friendly without being intrusive. The location was fine for my purposes and I walked to the station in 30 or so minutes. The only thing I noticed on the downside was a very faint odour of the stale canal water when windows were open but what could you do? Didn't turn on the TV so I can't assess that service.

Reviews.Title: “A charming hotel, which made our stay ...”
Reviews.Author: MIDGEBW
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in early August in room 201, which overlooks the Amstel river. This was a very spacious room & had a large balcony to boot! Every aspect of our stay was enjoyable. The staff, as has been said on previous reviews, were very friendly & helpful. The location suited us very well, within easy walking distance to all the attractions, without the noise & bustle of city centre sights & sounds. Approx 10 min walk to Rembrandtplein for instance. The free breakfast was enjoyable, although after 5 days, we felt a little variety would have been welcome. One very small niggle we had was that there was no tea/coffee making facilities in the room. We telephoned reception regarding this, and they were happy to provide refreshments, however it would have been nice to have had this convienience in our room itself. We would recommend paying that bit extra for the Amstel view rooms. The view from the room was amazing & we certainly made good use of our balcony! Overall a fab hotel in a fab location, and we definately plan to stay here again !

Reviews.Title: “convenient base, quiet location on the river”
Reviews.Author: bartok1
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in a quiet area, in a picturesque location right on the river, a bit removed from the busy-ness of the Museumplein and Leidesplein areas. The hotel is very convenient to the Waterlooplein and Rembrandtplein areas, including a tram to Central Station, and an easy walk to the tram (#7, #10) that is just a few stops away from the Leidesplein or the Museumplein or Vondel Park areas. There are no restaurants immediately next door, but an easy walk to cafes and restaurants. The staff were nice and helpful. I was traveling alone and had a very small single room â€“ so small I wondered at the outset if I had made a mistake. However, with a little getting used to, the room was just fine. Nothing fancy, but functional. I glanced in other rooms when doors were open as I was walking by, and they seemed much more spacious, so I think size is only an issue for the single rooms. The breakfast spread was generous, particularly in comparison to continental breakfasts that are offered in the US. Most of my stay was reasonably quiet, although the thinness of the walls was apparent one evening when my neighbors had their television turned on loudly. Free wifi was offered. Although the hotel did not have air-conditioning, it also wasnâ€™t needed, as it was cool in the evenings. I think Amsterdam is a beautiful city; let me offer a couple of quick suggestions that you may not find in the guidebooks. First, everyone bikes in Amsterdam, and I highly recommend that way of getting around. If youâ€™re used to biking, it actually doesnâ€™t take that long to get around Amsterdam. If you are looking for a really pretty, longer ride with little chance of getting lost, you can rent a bike and just follow the Amstel River going south, away from the city (bring the camera for the shots of windmills across the river), or for the more adventurous, you can bike along the dijks northeast of the city. If you donâ€™t want to rent a bike for 24 hours, but also donâ€™t want to bring it back at 5:45, as required by MacBikes, there is a place called Star Bikes behind Central Station that rents bikes that can be returned at 7:00 pm. Second, donâ€™t do like I did and try to find the free Wednesday noontime classical music rehearsals/concerts at the Concertgebouw during the summerâ€“ they apparently only have these during the regular season (not in summer months). :-) Luckily, there are plenty of other opportunities for all kinds of music in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view !”
Reviews.Author: edinpaul
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend with my friends. We stayed in a large loft apartment on the top floor of this hotel with beautiful views of the Amstel river. The apartment was very clean, with a kitchen, 2 bathrooms and an open plan living area. Surprisingly breakfast was included as part of our deal...very nice selection of fruit, cold meats and cereals. The hotel is in a very quiet residential area but you can easily walk or take a tram to the entertainment areas of the city. Reception staff were very helpful and allowed us free internet access. Great value for money and would definitely stay here if I return to Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming, cosy hotel in peaceful location”
Reviews.Author: CJBABCOCK
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week in this hotel by the quiet Amstel waterside - great place for relaxing, close to trams with friendly staff and good choice of buffet breakfast. Very reasonable rates for such a central location - next to Hermitage museum and a short stroll to trams taking you to Centraal Station and the Museum quarter. Amsterdam is a beautiful city and this small hotel offered the perfect base to explore and a very welcoming, personal service.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended for a quiet stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Mo_Laethanta_Saoire
Reviews.Content: We stayed in The Bridge Hotel for three nights. It was a very pleasant experience. The staff were very willing to help and offer advice about transport etc. Our triple room was very spacious and had a small balcony, complete with table and chairs overlooking a courtyard,. The bathroom was very modern. The room decor wasn't standard hotel style which wasn't a bad thing - almost 'boutique style'. The furniture was quirky e.g. tall metal lockers as wardrobes! Beds were very comfortable. As there is no lift in the hotel carrying cases up the stairs was hard work! While the breakfast buffet was acceptable, I found the choice a little limited in camparison to similar European hotels. There was alot of processed / packaged items and limited selection of bread and fresh fruit. The hotel is situated in a pleasant part of the city along the Amstel river. Our room at the back of the hotel proved very quiet. It is a short walk from the tram stops where there is direct access to the Centraal Station.

Reviews.Title: “Very accommodating staff welcomed us to this attractive hotel”
Reviews.Author: CutlerHaines
Reviews.Content: Free wi-fi throughout hotel, full breakfast, great location near stop for tram #9 or metro. Bike rental available at hotel or nearby Mac Bikes. Dedicated bike paths offer the best way to explore the City. Very comfy bed and linens/pillows.

Reviews.Title: “excellent in every way”
Reviews.Author: rotherhamSheffield
Reviews.Content: great location by the river,but walking distance tio everything.excellent value for money with good buffet breakfast included.staff very helpful and polite.room relaxed and clean with super power shower in the bathroom.we would definitely re book if returning to amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HorsleyPalf
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel, it is in a great spot with a 2 min walk to the tram stop, the hotel is on the water so a lovely romantic spot. We arrived before we could check in however the staff were happy for us to leave our bags in the locked store room which seemed very safe, the recpetion staff were super friendly they were happy to give info, Maps, recommendations. The room was small but cosy, a very good bed and all new looking furniture and television. The bathroom was great nice and big very clean and fresh. The breakfast was great, lots of breads, biscuits, cereals, juice etc more than enough to choose from. Felt safe walking back at night along the water, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a central location”
Reviews.Author: AfroGerm
Reviews.Content: i can only recommend the Bridge hotel. it is very centrally located, just perfect to roam most parts of the city. the staff we encountered was extremly friendly and very helpful. our room was a pleasant surprise compared to the rather vintage reception area it was nicely decorated and very clean. bathroom was updated and new. will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view and excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: Soulable
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at this lovely hotel in the double room with canal view and the balcony. From our arrival until our departure the service and hotel staff were impeccable. Our room was very modern and even had that type of "apartment" feeling. We were unlucky with the weather but we will definitely plan a trip back to Amsterdam and stay happily again at the Bridge. I strongly recommend this hotel that is located just outside the busy touristic areas but nevertheless within walking/biking distance of the city centre. The breakfast included in the halfboard is also a very good option to take, buffet style with a lot of fresh bread and various continental/Dutch products. Lastly the free wi-fi is very handy for keeping up with you personal emails without roaming charges or finding those precious last minute information about the city.

Reviews.Title: “Five (old) friends loved it!”
Reviews.Author: jennyb71
Reviews.Content: I can't praise this hotel enough - four friends and I, mostly in our 70's, stayed here for 3 nights. Everything was fantastic, the rooms, the food, they even had umbrellas you could borrow. The hotel was exceptionally quiet, and clean and the staff were very helpful. The number 9 tram (bus) is so easy to use to the end of the street, and we found some good eating places nearby - also a small supermarket for everyday bits and bobs, but they also did us some great baguettes to take on our journey home. The canalbus also stops very close. I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel for the budget aware”
Reviews.Author: willen123
Reviews.Content: Slightly out of the centre, but a very welcoming reception from the staff. The room was clean and modern with a really lovely canal view. Would definately stay here again. Worth taking advantage of hiring a bike, which they have an ample supply of at the hotel, no better way to get around amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - comfortable, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Sara50s
Reviews.Content: We were greeted by very friendly and efficient staff and all the staff maintained this high level of service throughout our stay. The room was airy, clean and comfortable and the breakfast buffet had a good selection of the usual Dutch breakfast fare. All in all - a lovely quiet hotel in a great location - I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: bearafan24
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a perferct location right at the Amstel river. The staff were very friendly and the room was very clean and comfortable, and nicely decorated. The price is excellent too.

Reviews.Title: “Go to The Bridge!”
Reviews.Author: eikoop
Reviews.Content: A great stay from beginning to end. Friendly, helpful, English speaking staff greeted us with a detailed area map and took the time to point out major sights and answer our destination questions. Super friendly to our young children! The triple room we stayed in (one lrg twin bed and one queen/king bed) was very large... perfect for our boys. No river view from this room but others have a river view. The room looked freshly renovated with a sparking clean bathroom (toilet, sink & shower). Decor was clean and modern with a few funky details. Large breakfast buffet with reasonable hours served in a light and bright breakfast room. There is definitely something for everyone for breakfast! Location can't be beat! Walking distance to everything we wanted to see... even with a three year old and no stroller! Easy walk to covered secure parking and major public transport lines. We even found a playground just down the street (part of a school but seemed to be open to the public when we were there on the weekend) to get our sons "wiggles" out before the 6 hr car ride home. We'd love to go back to Amsterdam and would definitely go back to The Bridge!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: DebbyL25
Reviews.Content: The Bridge Hotel, great location, great service and great room. Really comfy beds too and a really big, spacious room. Breakfast is the usual continental but there is a big selection to choose from and goes on until 10.30am, 11am on Sundays. The staff were friendly and really helpful, making dinner reservations for us when we asked. Cannot fault this hotel and wouldnt hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wahbehw
Reviews.Content: Great view on Amstel river. Close to downtown. Wonderful breakfast. *****

Reviews.Title: “A great find and would recommend it without hesitation”
Reviews.Author: TravelproNYC56
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderfully situated hotel, right on the Amstel River near the "Skinny Bridge" and very close to a street that has a number of excellent restaurants. We loved the location, which was walking distance to all the sites, yet not in the middle of all the hullabaloo so quiet. We didn't mind the extra 10 minutes of walking to be in a quieter part of town. The rooms were spare but clean and the beds were so comfortable. Definitely the coziest duvets ever! The rates are very reasonable and include breakfast. There is a bit of foot traffic outside as the Carre Theater is almost immediately next door and the circus was in town, but we had a room toward the back and it was very quiet. Our three children, ages 25, 22 and 19, shared a triple that had floor to ceiling windows with an amazing view of the Amstel River.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value - no hype, does all it says it will do.”
Reviews.Author: Ordinarycouple
Reviews.Content: Apart from not getting a room with a view of the Amstel (!) this was a very good hotel to stay in. Our room was very clean, as was all the hotel, large and warm and we did at least have a partial view of a small canal. It is not right in the thick of things, which suited us, but we walked everywhere from it and, even at my pace, the longest walk (to the station) was not too arduous. However, it is on tram/bus routes too. Breakfast was plentiful with lots of cheeses, ham, jams and fruit etc. Check out what is on at the next door theatre, we saw a really good show and, if you are really lucky, if they are not full on the night they move you down a little into more expensive seats. Plenty of restaurants just over the canal. Visit Haarlem if you have time, short, cheap journey on the train and a beautiful little place to visit - especially out of the main tourist times. Great museum and church and lots of restaurants and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: lac51161
Reviews.Content: Clean room and excellent service. All of the staff was helpful and friendly. The breakfast was more than enough and the area was very clean. From the Central Station, take the #9 bus to the Music Theater and then go down Amstel toward the Carre Theater. The Bridge Hotel is just before the Carre. Great location! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great everything!”
Reviews.Author: Euryop
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel with incredible pricing and superb central location on the canal! When you step past the Dutch brick facade into the lobby you'll be greeted by the friendliest staff ever. So helpful in every way. The rooms are surprisingly sleek and cosmo for the hotel's quaint exterior and we loved them! The rooms had just what we needed and no clutter to spare. Comfortable beds with crisp, clean linens, flat panel TV on the wall, a desk and some chairs under the large window. The bath was new and super clean. The buffet breakfast was another wonderful surprise. Eggs and cereals and toppings and breads and various meats and coffees and teas...it just went on! We loved it! Definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “A bizarre experience with my room on this trip”
Reviews.Author: pebx
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Bridge hotel on four previous occasions, and always found it excellent. But, when I went in August, I booked a double room, because I wanted extra comfort. When I arrived, I was booked into a twin room with two single beds. When I complained, I was actually told by the reception staff that they were trying to rent the double room which I had reserved to someone else. The room was not available on that day, but if I still wanted to change, they said I should let them know the next morning. I came back to the hotel on the second night to find that all my things had been moved to a new room, and that someone else had been moved into mine. I was absolutely appalled that my things had been moved without anyone even asking me - and not only that, but they had thrown away my toothbrush, toothpaste and razor. And the new double room, which I had requested in the first place, was actually damp and not aired properly. It really was bizarre.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with Dutch style in great location”
Reviews.Author: HMBoston
Reviews.Content: The bathroom and bedroom are organized in a Dutch way. Nice shower. Clean rooms, and nice cotton sheets in room with clean and simple style. Located right next to the Hermitage museum extension in Amsterdam. Very good value for good location. My room window looked onto small central courtyard airspace - no street noise. Great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location. Professional Service. Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Rambler55
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently positioned on the Amstel river. A pleasant fifteen minute stroll takes you into the heart of the city. (And it was good to be away from that heart during the all-night musical festivitives associated with Gay Pride weekend) The metro is just around the corner and trams are easily accessible. The staff at the hotel are welcoming and efficient. They were also able and willing to suggest places to eat and gave clear directions to places of interest. The continental breakfast is of good quality. The rooms are functional but fit for purpose. The single rooms are perhaps a little too snug. However, there do constitute value for money.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: BaldEagleHarrogate
Reviews.Content: Use this hotel regularly on business and it never disappoints. Location is probably second to none wthin the City. River at the front and a canal down one side and another across the back. Plenty of passing interest at all times and in summer a beer on the bench outside is a must. Plenty of restaurants within a few hundred yards and the City Centre not too far. Quick and easy access to The RAI Conference Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent & quiet location with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: seaneastmidlands
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was perfectly located in the middle of all tourist attractions. It was very easy to take a bus, tram, metro or walk to all major locations/attractions. The staff was very friendly, approachable and helpful. The room was perfect in size, very clean and bathroom was quite big and also nice and clean. The room was cleaned every day (beds made up etc). The only downfall was lack of lift in the hotel & at breakfast there could have been more hot food.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but small”
Reviews.Author: virgo_08
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel in end December. Used the tripadvisor rankings, and then directly emailed the hotel. Pros 1. Great location. Right in front of the Amstel canal. 2. Good housekeeping. 3. Nice cafeteria around the corner. 4. Walked to pretty much everywhere in Amsterdam. Cons 1. The rooms are quite small. 2. Can get stuffy. 3. The breakfast in the basement isn't wow.

Reviews.Title: “Away from the Amsterdam Madness”
Reviews.Author: ClovaTheWestie
Reviews.Content: We had initially booked 3 rooms at this hotel and had to cancel one room at very short notice. This was done very efficiently and with no problems from the staff, who were very helpful throughout our stay. We were staying in Amsterdam for a football match and in all the hotel was very tolerant of supporters who had possibly had a little too much of Amsterdam entertainment so again, top marks! The hotel itself is situated about a 10 minute walk from Waterloosplein Metro station, along the very scenic Amstel Canal. The hotel I would describe as traditional Dutch buildiing with a modern twist to the interior. We had a room with no view but I would imagine the rooms at the front have great views of the canal. The rooms are modern with very clean and tidy wetroom style bathrooms. For Amsterdam, bedrooms were large and spacious. Breakfast is served in the basement and is traditional Continental Europe fare, with plenty on offer for all. I liked the area. There are some very good bars around Waterloosplein and it is close enough to walk into the heart of the city yet is far enough away from the madness that it disrupts your stay. The area is very quiet at night. I would highly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “terrible service”
Reviews.Author: coffemug
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel for one night durig a buissness stay. When I wanted to chck in, I could neither pay by credit card nor by my bank card due to a technical problem of the hotel's machine. When I asked to pay cash next morning, the receptionist refused and made me go to a ATM although it was raining. That sucks. Morovere, the room was in front of the hotel terrace, so there were people directely in front of my room all the time. Finally, next morning, I was called in my room by the receptionist. He told me I should leave immedeately because it was check out time. Very rude!

Reviews.Title: “Worst stay ever!”
Reviews.Author: LondonMisa
Reviews.Content: We booked quite late but having read the reviews on this website we were pleased to be able to get a reservation. It was my fiancee's birthday weekend and this sounded like an ideal place to stay. However, on arrival we were allocated a room right opposite the reception. We could hear everything going on there despite the receptionist's promise that that wouldn't be the case. Every few minutes the front doorbell would ring and then the ensuing conversation in reception could be clearly heard. Of course we complained and reqested a change of room. This request was refused and we were given the option of finding an alternative hotel yet still having to pay the bill. We did in fact try this as I wanted to rescue what was supposed to be a romantic weekend break. Amsterdam does get pretty well booked up so we resigned ourselves to staying a night in the Bridge Hotel. By this time another receptionist had started their shift and also refused to change our room and gave a different answer as to the whereabouts of the manager. This receptionist rudely told us to go away. In the morning, a third receptionist was on duty and gave a third differing story as to the whereabouts of the hotel manager. We never did find out where the manager was. However, we were now given the option of changing rooms - two options were given - both rooms had been empty the night before and the receptionist could not understand why we were not offered these rooms on our arrival. The new room was better but you could still hear the breakfast staff getting everything prepared in the morning. Service therefore gets zero out of 10. The location is not too bad - only a little further from the main attractions than we had imagined but that's probably a good thing as some of the streets can be very noisy. Breakfast was good (but had to request a new tray of meat and cheese to be brought out) but bread rolls and croissants would have been a nice addition. We will not be staying here again. We didn't even get a goodbye on our departure.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: AussiePomGirl
Reviews.Content: My sister and I had room 103, a twin room opposite the reception desk on the ground floor. If you are a light sleeper and do not like using ear plugs, make sure you don't get this room or 102 next door. It is a bit noisy especially at night. Staff were smoking in the reception area too, so this was a little annoying when stepping outside the room, although it didn't seem to permeate the room itself. Otherwise, we found this hotel very pleasant. The location is close to most tourist attractions, but not in the main tourist area near Dam Square, which was a bonus for us, as we found that area very tacky and the bars and restaurants overpriced. We did not have a room with a view, but the facitilies in the room and hotel in general were clean and functional, if a little basic. We found plenty of good, reasonably priced restaurants and bars nearby, especially the one just adjacent to the bridge about a block down. Breakfast included in the room rate offered a good selection - my sister is celiac and didn't find any problem selecting from the foods on offer to make a tasty breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and views”
Reviews.Author: Obelix72
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights. The room was very spacious. We booked one of the rooms with Amstel view. Therefore great views especially at night time. I can comment on the cheaper rooms to the back. The rooms were very clean, but equipped very basic. All looks like coming from IKEA - and it prob does. In relation to overall prices and standards in Amsterdam, it is good value for money. I don't think it is easy to find such big rooms so close to the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect. We loved it.”
Reviews.Author: cgehrke
Reviews.Content: My wife and took a much deserved 2 night break during the midweek. We knew the weather might be cold and rainy but did not care. We were prepared. We found the hotel easily after a few minutes with the taxi man finding it on the list. Once we arrived we found the place just charming. The location and view from the hotel was stunning, especially at night when all the bridges are lit up. We stayed in the Amstel Room which has a small balcony over looking the front of the hotel and of course, the Amstel river. The first night we walked the city just looking and shopping and eventually found a place to eat. Not from lack of choices but rather from too many choices. The next day we rented bikes (a must in Amsterdam if your into that sort of thing) and basically visited the whole city. Before 3 pm we were able to see Rembrandt, Van Gogh and Ann Frank's House due to our central starting and ending point. On the second night, the theater next door had an event and we thought it might be noisy with people but we did not hear a thing. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The breakfast was nice and as an American I found it a bit interesting but still delicious. This was my 3rd time to Amsterdam and by far my most enjoyable. Even though the weather was cold it remained clear. I will be staying here again or sure.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Room, Beautiful View!”
Reviews.Author: from_Ohio_with_love
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in the hotel and loved it! The room was very large and spotlessly clean. The bed was very comfortable, though our two-twins-to-make-a-king-size kept drifting apart in the night. Ensuite bathroom was also big and included a large shower stall, toilet, and sink. Our room was on the first floor and had a great view of the river right outside. The location was excellent- we had a great morning run along the canals and easily walked the city later in the day. Breakfast was great; lots of options downstairs in the lovely dining area. The staff was very helpful, allowing us to store our bags with them while we explored Amsterdam after checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, refreshing hotels with persona touch and easy access”
Reviews.Author: incrediblepie
Reviews.Content: If you are in Amsterdam for a few days and appreciate a personal touch to your hotel stay then you should try and get a few nights here. This is a clean compact and very well decorated hotel. My room was quite large -spotlessly clean - and with a large bathroom. My favorite point was the decor. It doesn't make or break the stay but having a room with refreshing design makes it stand out from the other "chain" hotels that are the same the world over. Bathroom was large with big walking shower. Impeccably designed and maintained. Room view was not much but who cares it was very bright and airy due to big opening windows. Bed was very comfy. Large steel, dressing room style locker may not be to everyones taste but was useful and secure for storing baggage (bring a lock) and added to the decor. Breakfast is usual buffet style, but of top notch quality. Bread, meats, cheeses, jams, all of v high quality. Staff welcoming and always with a smile even at 4 in the morning. Cost of room is well worth it, plus you are in walking distance of trams and metro and with an effort you can walk right into centre. One negative point to watch out for (not 100% due to hotel) was the taxi ordered for a trip to airport. I asked specifically for taxi who took credit card. They don't order a taxi, more a limo service, which can cost up to 60 euro and they (taxi people) make a REALLY big deal over paying with credit card...was pretty stressful at 4 in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for your money in Amsterdam terms”
Reviews.Author: tupsundus
Reviews.Content: The rooms are simple, the location is quite central (when we stayed, the queen had her birthday party literally next door, in the CarrÃ© theatre), the breakfast was okay and the staff was very friendly. We read that others had had trouble with noise due to thin walls but we didn't experience any of it. We would be happy to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Marreck
Reviews.Content: Good location, rooms OK, but the walls are so thin that it is almost possible to follow a conversation in the room next door. In a city with many tourists enjoying the nightlife and coming back very late, it can be unpleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Like living in the dorms”
Reviews.Author: k_r_LosAngeles
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to me for its rooms offering charming views of the Amstel river. I stayed for one week at the Bridge Hotel and had a room with a view for 2 nights, but this did not make up for the overall experience. The hotel reminds me of the dorm in which I spent my junior year abroad in Europe. The decor is very worn, the floors are dirty and the bathroom utilitarian at best. But, mostly, the staff acts as though they are "housesitting," or filling in for someone else. Once, I rang the front bell to be let in (it was below freezing outside) and waited more than 10 minutes while the person who managed the front desk was fixing a plumbing problem. There are simply no staff around. On another day when I returned in the evening to my room and realized that the cleaning staff had not provided any soap, the front desk could not offer any solutions. When I asked for "hotel services," I was told that the office equipment like copy machine was "broken." I had to walk to a copy place. Finally, when asked to switch my "room with a view" to another one, I was told to check out all my things at 11 a.m., put my suitcases behind the front desk, and wait until 3 p.m. before I could have my new room (I wasn't leaving the hotel, merely switching rooms). I was insulted since my stay was a week long, and I protested; it took over an hour to convince the only staff member that this procedure was unacceptable. There is simply no professional person working there, much like my college dorm experience. This is a bare-bones place. The view is nice. The location is fine. I am ranking one notch above terrible because the location was close to metro and trolleys.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie0420
Reviews.Content: The location is pretty good; central to a lot of different things that are walking distance, close to a lot of tram spots and quiet. The rooms were really clean and beds comfy. I appreciated the large bathrooms. Breakfast was great and convenient to start the day. For more of a "scene" i would tell people to stay somwhere in the Jordaan, but for the $$, value and cleanliness, I would stay here again.
